contentrichtext.text: {{Expand Estonian|Aegna|topic=geo|date=July 2010}} [[Image:Aegna coast.jpg|thumb|Aegna coast]] '''Aegna''' is an [[Estonia]]n [[island]] in the [[Bay of Tallinn]] in the [[Baltic Sea]]. Administratively it is part of the city of [[Tallinn]], the capital of [[Estonia]] and is a sub district of the [[Kesklinn, Tallinn|Kesklinn]] (City center) district. ==Geography== Aegna island has an area of around 3 km<sup>2</sup>, and can be found off the [[Viimsi peninsula]], around 1.5 km NW of [[Rohuneeme]] and 14 km north of [[Tallinn]]. It has a 10 km coastline which includes two sandy beaches. The highest point of the island is about 13m above sea level. As of 1 June 2011 Aegna had 8 permanent residents.<ref name=population>{{cite web|title=Statistical Yearbook of Tallinn 2011|url=http://www.tallinn.ee/est/g2677s56143|publisher=Tallinn City Government|accessdate=24 February 2012|page=153}}</ref> ==Attractions== Aegna is a popular destination for day and camping trips, and has around 15 km of walking routes. ==History== Historically Aegna has been used for military purposes, and military remains that can still be seen include those of a military watchtower, a large gun battery with underground tunnels, and the light railway used in its construction. On 10 August 2005 a [[Copterline]] helicopter on [[Tallinn]]â€“[[Helsinki]] route [[Copterline Flight 103|crashed]] 3 km south of the island. All 14 people on the helicopter died. ==Transport== The small ferry Juku operates to and from the island during the summer months,<ref>http://www.aegnareisid.ee/laevatransport/</ref> with support from the city of Tallinn.<ref>http://www.tallinn.ee/est/Aegna-liinilaeva-JUKU-operaatoriks-valiti-AS-Kihnu-Veeteed</ref> In the summer of 2010 the Juku was operated by [[Kihnu veeteed]] <ref>http://www.veeteed.com/index.php?moodul=101&mode=1&piletiost=1</ref> During the summer Tallinn-Cruises operate sightseeing tours to the island using the boat "Monica" <ref>http://www.tallinn-cruises.com/</ref> The island can also be reached by boats or yachts chartered from [[Pirita]] Harbour <ref>http://www.aegnareisid.ee/veetakso/</ref> ==See also== *[[List of islands of Estonia]] == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://aegna.ee/index.php Island information] {{Islands of Estonia}} {{Islands in the Baltic Sea}} {{Tallinn}} {{coord|59|34|50|N|24|45|28|E|display=title}} {{Commons category|Aegna}} [[Category:Islands of Estonia]] [[Category:Subdistricts of Tallinn]] [[Category:Geography of Tallinn]] [[Category:Kesklinn, Tallinn]] {{Harju-geo-stub}} {{Tallinn-geo-stub}} {{Link GA|cs}}
